sect2.title: Introduction to a2ps
sect2.para: a2ps is a filter utilitized mainly in the background and primarily by printing scripts to convert almost every input format into PostScript output. The application's name expands appropriately to "all to PostScript".

sect2.title: Installation of a2ps
sect2.para: Install a2ps by running the following commands:

userinput.command: cd contrib && cp Makefile.in Makefile.in.orig && sed -e "s:emacs::" Makefile.in.orig > Makefile.in && cd .. && cp configure{,.orig} && sed -e 's|/usr/local/share/ghostscript|/usr/share/ghostscript|g' \ configure.orig > configure && ./configure --prefix=/usr \ --sysconfdir=/etc/a2ps --localstatedir=/var \ --with-medium=letter && make && make install

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: cd contrib && cp Makefile.in Makefile.in.orig && sed -e "s:emacs::" Makefile.in.orig > Makefile.in && cd .. && These commands eliminate the compiling and installing of the Emacs script files. If you have substituted Emacs for Vi as your primary editor, you would want to skip these instructions.

cp configure{,.orig} && sed -e 's|/usr/local/share/ghostscript|/usr/share/ghostscript|g' \ configure.orig > configure This command modifies the configure script to search for Ghostscript fonts at the location where they were installed by the BLFS instructions.
--sysconfdir=/etc/a2ps: Configuration data goes to /etc/a2ps instead of /usr/etc.
--with-medium=letter: This switch changes the default paper format of A4 to letter. Installations that utilize A4 would eliminate this switch.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: Information about configuring a2ps can be found in the comments contained in the above files, and also by running info a2ps.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The a2ps package contains a2ps and filter data.

sect3.title: a2ps
sect3.para: a2ps is a filter, utilized primarily by printing scripts, that converts standard input or supported files to PostScript.
